reviews.text: We checked in and the AIR CONDITIONING was not working. The front desk said is would be fixed by dinner time...I recalled reading a review on trip advisor about this hotel and how the air conditioning was not working. We decided to check out and not take any chances! We went to a hotel across the street for less money and AIR CONDITIONING and the rooms were just as nice.
reviews.title: No air conditioning

reviews.text: Our first room was huge but with a tiny bathroom. No problem we thought, settling down for a quick sleep. One hour later the sweat was pouring off us - the air conditioning was non-existent, no matter how we adjusted/battered/swore at the very large, noisy and antiquated unit on the wall. After asking to be moved we were given the choice of two rooms - we chose the one overlooking the street, which had a huge bathroom and some semblance of air conditioning (but not much). Sleep at last!
reviews.title: Hot stuff!
prepare to sweat
reviews.text: The air conditioning was the only thing wrong with the hotel - the rest was very clean, the staff polite and helpful and the breakfast more than ample. And it's only a five-minute walk to the main square, which is beautiful.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Tre Vechhi
reviews.text: All in all, we reckon the hotel was once a grand four-star but is now in need of some attention (ie someone with a spanner to fix the a/c).
Oh, and it's further from the train station than you might think, particularly on a hot day with heavy bags. A taxi is only about six euros - well worth it.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel
Bologna Hotel
reviews.text: Cheap and worth the money--hotel with plastic where marble should be. Noisy and completely unlovely.

I just got back from Italy and since I got such great help from this site I decided to write my reviews. Hotel Tre Vecchi was great. I was originally booked at the Hotel Regina, right next door and run by the same company. When I got there they told me the hotel was full but I will be accommodated at the hotel next door. It worked out for the best. My room was a standard single. So if you are from the US forget about a huge room, in general all rooms in Europe are much smaller that the ones in the US.
reviews.title: Definitely would come back
The floor plan's an adventure in itself
reviews.text: Anyway, the hotel was great. Located within walk distance of the train station, and in the main shopping street of Bologna, a couple of blocks form the main square. I could have not dream of a better location.

reviews.title: 4 star location, pity about the noise
reviews.text: The room was super clean, a very comfortable bed, and an adequate bathroom. Breakfast was great. The staff was very cordial and helpful. I totally recommend it and would definitely stay back there.

reviews.title: Simply Comfortable
reviews.text: The Tre Vecchi is ideally situated along the big Via Dell'Indipendenza shopping street downtown, close to the train station. The building is set back from the street, with a well-shaded and grassy parklike area in between. You're a short walk away from stores, restaurants, the university, and major attractions such as the twin towers, Piazza del Nettuno, and Basilica del Santo Stefano.

reviews.title: Nice decor - shame about the amenities
reviews.text: The decor is quite nice, but there were some huge problems with the Tre Vecchi: The bathroom smelled like a sewer; Despite turning off the heat, the room was unbearably hot all day and night; Non-stop noise from traffic outside the hotel could clearly be heard through the 'sound-proof' window; The bed and pillows were uncomfortable; and The hotel cannot or does not change money - even on a Sunday when all the banks are closed. The room looked nice, though.
